# Steps to reproduce
Open PowerShell console with Administrator right, and type in the following commands.
The search item (here Installer) is irrelevant, also reproducible with wildcards.
```powershell
cd HKLM:
dir -Recurse -Name -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue -Include Installer
```
# Expected behavior
Get-ChildItem returns found registry subkeys.

# Actual behavior
PowerShell crashes with StackOverflowException.

![PS6-StackOverflowCrash](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10983684/61749449-c9692680-addd-11e9-8dc8-9621103acc0e.PNG)

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
PS > $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17134
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
# Notes
After further investigation I've come to the conclusion that the cause is a registry entry that has `/` as its name.
```none
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Setup\PnpResources\Registry\HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\usbhub\/
```
This causes Get-ChildItem to recurse back to the root item endlessly and finally triggers stack overflow.

Not reproducible with non-administrative user rights due to the registry key's access permission disallows reading its child items.

Also reproducible with PS 5.1.
